workflow.name: Automate CV screening & analysis with Telegram, Gemini AI & Google Workspace
workflow.description:
## üß© What Problem Does It Solve?
Manually reviewing CVs from Telegram job applicants is slow, error-prone, and often inconsistent. This workflow automates the collection, analysis, and storage of CVs ‚Äî saving HR teams hours while ensuring structured, high-quality candidate data for fast decision-making.

## üìù Description
This workflow is built to help HR teams collect and qualify CVs sent over Telegram. It verifies that a candidate submits a valid PDF, stores the file securely, extracts key information using AI, and logs everything neatly in Google Sheets.

## üéØ Key Advantages for HR Teams
‚úÖ Automatically filters out non-PDF and invalid messages
‚úÖ Uses AI to extract clean, structured candidate data
‚úÖ Links CV files to Google Sheets for easy HR access
‚úÖ Eliminates manual data entry from physical CVs
‚úÖ Provides a scalable CV pipeline via Telegram

## üõ†Ô∏è Features
Telegram bot for CV collection

MIME-type PDF validation

Google Drive integration for secure storage

Text extraction from PDFs

Gemini AI-powered CV parsing

Google Sheets integration for candidate logging

Merge logic to synchronize multiple streams

JSON-safe parsing for AI output

Automatic job title and experience categorization

Duplicate prevention through name-based matching

## üîß Requirements
A Telegram bot token

Google Drive API credentials

Google Sheets API credentials

Gemini API key (or another LLM)

n8n instance with relevant credentials configured

Candidates sending CVs in PDF format

## üß† Use Case Examples
Recruitment Agencies: Automate pre-screening and reduce manual effort

Small Startups: Collect high-quality CVs without paying for an ATS

Internship Programs: Quickly categorize applicants by experience

Remote Hiring: Accept global CVs via Telegram from mobile users

Freelancer Portals: Auto-log contractor profiles from incoming resumes

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Tips
 1-Set up Telegram Bot API credentials
 2-Configure Google Drive API access
 3-Configure Google Sheets API access
 4-Configure Google Gemini/PaLM API access
 5-Replace all placeholder IDs with your actual values

If you need any help [Get in Touch](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abdallaelshikh0/)

parameters.text:
=You are an expert HR assistant specializing in CV analysis and candidate qualification.From {{ $json.text }} Your task is to extract key information from CV content and categorize candidates based on their experience level.
Instructions:
Analyze the provided CV text and extract the following information with high accuracy:

Full Name: Extract the candidate's complete name (first and last name)
Phone Number: Find and format phone numbers (include country code if available without + )
Email Address: Extract the primary email address
Job Title: Identify the current or most recent job title/position
Experience Analysis: Calculate total years of professional experience and categorize

Experience Categorization Rules:

Junior: 0-3 years of professional experience
Senior: 3-6 years of professional experience
Expert: 6+ years of professional experience

Experience Calculation Guidelines:

Count only professional work experience (internships count as 0.5x)
Calculate total duration from all positions
If less than 12 months, express in months
If 12+ months, express in years (round to 1 decimal place)
Overlapping positions should not be double-counted
Consider career gaps but focus on actual work experience


Output Format:
Return ONLY a valid JSON object in this exact format:

{
  "name": "Full Name Here",
  "phone_number": "+1234567890 or Not Found",
  "email": "email@example.com or Not Found",
  "job_title": "Current/Recent Job Title or Not Found",
  "experience": ["Category: X.X years"]
}
Please send your CV in PDF format only

parameters.content: Captures incoming CV PDFs from candidates
Gets the file download link from Telegram
Sends a message asking the user to resend the CV in PDF format if validation fails.
Uploads the downloaded PDF file to Google Drive.
Combines the file storage and download paths to pass data forward to extraction.
Extracts text content from the uploaded PDF file for analysis.
Analyzes CV text and extracts structured data like name, phone number, email, experience, and job title.
Cleans and maps the structured JSON AI output into individual fields for use in Google Sheets
Saves the extracted candidate information and CV link into a Google Sheet, updating existing entries if needed.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
